episodeTitle: The Girl Searching for the Yagara! Great Investigation in the Water Metropolis!
episodeTitleJapanese: ヤガラを探す少女！水の都大捜査線！
episodeTitleRomanized: Yagara o Sagasu Shōjo! Mizu no Miyako Daisōsasen!
description: While walking around Water 7, Luffy and Chopper meet a young girl named Abi, who's searching for her pet Yagara named Aobire that has been missing since the Aqua Laguna incident. Together they search the city and eventually discover Aobire's heroic sacrifice to save a baby Yagara.

events.title: Abi's First Appearance
events.description: A young girl named Abi appears in Water 7, having recurring dreams about her missing pet Yagara, Aobire. She is determined to find him despite her parents suggesting she move on.
events.significance: Introduces the episode's main character and sets up the central conflict of the filler episode.

events.title: Introduction of Aobire
events.description: Abi explains to Luffy and Chopper about Aobire, her elderly pet Yagara Bull who went missing during the Aqua Laguna flood. He is over 100 years old with a distinctive blue dorsal fin and wears a blue scarf that Abi gave him.
events.significance: Establishes the object of the search and Aobire's importance to Abi.

events.title: Luffy Agrees to Help Find Aobire
events.description: Abi offers Luffy her entire life savings as payment to help find Aobire. Despite initially being reluctant, Luffy agrees to help search for the missing Yagara.
events.significance: Sets the main plot of the episode in motion and demonstrates Luffy's willingness to help those in need.

events.title: Search Throughout Water 7
events.description: Luffy, Chopper, and Abi question various residents of Water 7 including Galley-La employees, the Franky Family, and Grandma Kokoro. Despite their efforts, no one has seen Aobire.
events.significance: Shows the bonds the Straw Hats have formed with the people of Water 7 and revisits familiar faces.

events.title: Chopper Speaks with Yagara Bulls
events.description: Using his ability to communicate with animals, Chopper speaks with a Yagara who tells him that he heard Aobire's voice, providing the first real clue in their search.
events.significance: Demonstrates Chopper's unique ability to talk to animals, which proves crucial to the investigation.

events.title: Discovery of Underground Tunnels
events.description: Shreds of Aobire's blue scarf wash up from a nearby opening to underground tunnels. Luffy, Chopper, and Abi enter the tunnels with their Yagara to continue searching.
events.significance: Leads the group to a new location and brings them closer to discovering Aobire's fate.

events.title: Revelation of Water 7's Underground City
events.description: As they travel through the tunnels, they discover a ruined underground city. Abi explains that in Water 7, new buildings were simply built over the old ones due to the recurring Aqua Laguna floods.
events.significance: Provides world-building information about Water 7's unique architecture and history of dealing with the annual floods.

events.title: Arrival at Tsui Village
events.description: Luffy, Chopper, and Abi arrive at Tsui Village, a mystical underground location where Yagara Bulls go to die. The place has a peaceful, otherworldly atmosphere.
events.significance: Introduces the concept of Tsui Village as a sacred resting place for Yagara Bulls, adding spiritual depth to the episode.

events.title: Discovery of Aobire's Death
events.description: Aobire's spirit appears before Abi, Luffy, and Chopper. Through Chopper's translation, Aobire reveals that he has died and found peace in Tsui Village. He sacrificed himself during the Aqua Laguna to rescue a baby Yagara Bull, wrapping it in his scarf to protect it from the cold.
events.significance: The emotional climax of the episode, revealing Aobire's heroic final act and providing closure to Abi's search.

quotes.speaker: Aobire (via Chopper)
quotes.context: Aobire's spirit explaining to Abi that he has passed away

events.title: Yagara Bulls Mourn Aobire
events.description: After Aobire's spirit departs, all the Yagaras and King Bulls throughout Water 7 begin crying out simultaneously, mourning the loss of one of their eldest members.
events.significance: Shows the spiritual connection between Yagara Bulls and honors Aobire's memory across the entire city.

events.title: Baby Yagara Discovery
events.description: Abi finds a crying, weakened baby Yagara wrapped in Aobire's blue scarf - the same infant that Aobire gave his life to save during the Aqua Laguna.
events.significance: Provides a bittersweet conclusion to the story, as Aobire's sacrifice saved a new life.

events.title: Abi Adopts the Baby Yagara
events.description: Abi decides to adopt and care for the baby Yagara that Aobire saved, honoring his final wish and finding purpose in continuing his legacy.
events.significance: Shows Abi's growth and acceptance of Aobire's death while honoring his memory by caring for the baby.

events.title: Luffy Refuses Payment
events.description: When Abi tries to pay Luffy with her life savings as promised, Luffy refuses the money and tells her to use it to help the baby Yagara grow up healthy instead.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's generous nature and that he helped Abi out of kindness rather than for the reward.

quotes.speaker: Aobire (via Chopper)
quotes.context: Aobire's spirit explaining his passing to Abi

themes.description: The episode explores themes of unconditional love through Abi's dedication to finding Aobire and Aobire's ultimate sacrifice to save an innocent life.
themes.symbolism: The blue scarf represents the bond between Abi and Aobire, continuing to protect and warm even after death.
culturalReferences: The concept of Tsui Village as a resting place for souls mirrors Japanese Buddhist beliefs about the afterlife and ancestor veneration.

themes.description: Abi must come to terms with Aobire's death while finding purpose in caring for the baby Yagara he saved.
themes.symbolism: The baby Yagara represents new life, hope, and the continuation of Aobire's legacy.

themes.description: Luffy helps Abi purely out of kindness and refuses payment, demonstrating that true heroism doesn't require reward.

characterSpotlights.development: Abi learns to accept the loss of her beloved pet Aobire while finding purpose in honoring his memory by caring for the baby Yagara he saved.
keyActions: Searches desperately for Aobire throughout Water 7
Offers her life savings to Luffy for help
Discovers the truth about Aobire's heroic death
Adopts the baby Yagara Aobire saved

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his characteristic kindness and lack of interest in material reward.
keyActions: Agrees to help Abi search for Aobire
Searches throughout Water 7 with Chopper and Abi
Refuses payment and tells Abi to use the money for the baby Yagara

characterSpotlights.development: Uses his ability to communicate with animals to serve as a bridge between Aobire's spirit and Abi.
keyActions: Speaks with Yagara Bulls to gather information
Translates Aobire's final message to Abi

characterSpotlights.development: Revealed to have sacrificed his life to save a baby Yagara during the Aqua Laguna.
keyActions: Rescued baby Yagara during Aqua Laguna flood
Protected the infant with his scarf
Appeared as a spirit to give Abi closure

mangaDifferences.difference: This entire episode is anime-original filler content with no manga equivalent.

trivia.fact: Episodes 317-319 form a three-episode filler arc set during the Post-Enies Lobby Arc.
This episode aired during the Post-Enies Lobby Arc, between the major canon events of the Water 7 Saga.
Tsui Village, featured in this episode, is a mystical location where Yagara Bulls go to die, similar to elephant graveyards in folklore.
This episode has an IMDB rating of 6.3/10, lower than most canon episodes but appreciated for its emotional story.
By episode 317, One Piece had stopped airing ending themes, a practice that began at episode 279 and continued until episode 1071.
